Dispute_Type: Employment dispute involving sexual harassment and discrimination
Legal_Issue: Whether the applicant can obtain an interlocutory injunction to halt proceedings pending judicial review
Procedural_Stage: Judicial review application; motion for interlocutory injunction
Evidence_Assessment: Applicant failed to utilize opportunities provided by the Commission to submit new evidence
Burden_of_Proof: Applicant bears burden to prove serious issue to be tried, irreparable harm, and balance of convenience
Legal_Rule: Interim order under s. 18.2 of the Federal Court Act requires: serious issue to be tried, irreparable harm, balance of convenience
Procedural_Issue: Alleged procedural unfairness due to lack of opportunity to present new evidence
Grounds_for_Claim: Sexual harassment complaint by former employee against the bank
Judicial_Review_Outcome: Injunction denied; tribunal proceedings allowed to continue
Review_Standard: Serious issue to be tried, irreparable harm, balance of convenience
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Court found no procedural unfairness as applicant had opportunities to present evidence
Key_Evidence_Considered: Opportunities provided by the Commission for evidence submission

Applicant_Challenge: Seeking to pause tribunal proceedings during judicial review
Standard_of_Proof: Balance of probabilities for interim relief
Remedy_Requested: Interlocutory injunction to halt tribunal proceedings
Resolution_Mechanism: Judicial review with request for interim injunction
Authority: Canadian Human Rights Tribunal; Federal Court
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Procedural unfairness, lack of opportunity to submit new evidence
Applicable_Process: Tribunal proceedings under human rights legislation
Outcome_of_Review: Proceedings not stayed; judicial review ongoing
